file_content.text: Hold your fire, men! Hold your fire! It's the Jedi the Council sent.
Sorry, Jedi. We're all a little on edge.
I understand you have every right to be on edge.
I don't blame you.
Thanks. We've contained Laranna, but I don't know what to do.
Everyone okay?
We're pretty shook up but at least we're alive. No thanks to Laranna.
Just tell me where Laranna Fain is.
I'm here for your passenger.
She's, uh, well, we managed to trap her in the aft section of the ship. This is all so wrong.
She was a great passenger at first--happy, smart, interested in the ship. But then we were hit by an Imperial ambush.
Laranna fought them off, almost died from her wounds. After a day or so, she started talking strange. And then... the slaughter.
So she was hurt, and then she went insane?
The injury started it?
What was she saying that seemed odd?
Talking strange?
Always the same thing: "Darkness, the darkness is coming." But--wait, that started later.
If she was so badly injured, why couldn't you stop her?
But she was "almost dead."
It didn't go like that.
After the ambush, we put out a call for medical assistance, and a Jedi Master answered. He healed her right up.
He was... odd, though. Had these horrible scars he kept covering, never said his name. You know, Laranna was different after he left.
It's possible he wasn't a Jedi at all.
An imposter, perhaps?
But he healed her. The girl's as strong as a rancor.
Other Jedi are suffering from a similar illness; he could have given it to her.
Maybe he made her sick.
I don't think so--he healed her. She's as strong as ever. Stronger, even.
It was a struggle, but we managed to trap her in the aft section. If I can just--
Right now, it's more important that we focus on stopping her.
Forget him.
Right. We managed to trap her in the stern of the ship, but we--
Lieutenant Whinn! Laranna's slicing into the Carida's systems!
She's taking over the whole ship. She'll start shutting down life support soon.
No! Jedi, please! You're the only one who stands a chance of stopping her.
Do whatever you have to. Just don't let Laranna kill any more of my men.
I will not fail.
Maybe Laranna would listen to a fellow Jedi.
I'll see what can be done.
This won't be a challenge.
Thank you. I'll release the lockdown for a moment to let you in, but I won't risk Laranna getting out.
There's a comm device back there; contact me when you've taken care of her, and I'll release the lockdown again so you can leave. Good luck.
